description: Number of partitions of n into parts all relatively prime to n.
comments: p is prime iff a(p) = A000041(p)-1. - _Lior Manor_ Feb 04 2005
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: Coefficient of x^n in expansion of 1/Product_{d : gcd(d, n)=1} (1-x^d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 23 2004
example: The unresticted partitions of 4 are 1+1+1+1, 1+1+2, 1+3, 2+2 and 4. Of these, only 1+1+1+1 and 1+3 contain parts which are all relatively prime to 4. So a(4) = 2.
prog: (PARI) R(n, v)=if(#v<2 || n<v[2], n>=0, sum(i=1, #v, R(n-v[i], v[1..i])))a(n)=if(isprime(n), return(numbpart(n)-1)); R(n, select(k->gcd(k, n)==1, vector(n, i, i))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 13 2012(PARI) a(n)=polcoeff(1/prod(k=1,n,if(gcd(k,n)==1,1-x^k,1), O(x^(n+1))+1), n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 13 2012(Haskell)a057562 n = p (a038566_row n) n where   p _          0 = 1   p []         _ = 0   p ks'@(k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p ks' (m - k) + p ks m-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 05 2013
crossrefs: See also A098743 (parts don't divide n).
author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 03 2000
